title: The Portrait of a Lady - behaviour

content.question: In the first sentence of the passage, the narrator presents Mrs. Touchett’s “behaviour” as

choices.label: an explanation for why Mr. Touchett prefers to live apart from his wife
an exception to Mrs. Touchett’s general pattern of conduct
an example of Mrs. Touchett’s steadfast commitment to her family
a revealing illustration of Mrs. Touchett’s character

content.answer: a revealing illustration of Mrs. Touchett’s character

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
